intro: Androcymbium cedarbergense, commonly known as the Cedarberg lily, is a unique flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces large, bell-shaped blooms in shades of white and pink, often with a yellow or orange throat. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
